title: Queen moves photo of Meghan Markle and Prince Harry - but leaves Kate and Wills
text:

The Queen fills her home with photos of her loved ones, and gorgeous pictures of her children, grandchildren and great grandchildren sit in frames around her rooms.

We often get to see a small selection of her proud collection in one of the reception rooms in Buckingham Palace when she hosts special guests there and shares official photos from the occasion.

The photos are often moved around and rearranged, but photos of Princes Charles, William and Harry with their wives are always in pride of place.

However in the most recent snap taken in her luxurious living room the photo of Harry and Meghan Markle has vanished from it's usual spot.

Back when the Monarch met Boris Johnson when he became Prime Minister in July, we could clearly see a shot believed to be from their engagement photoshoot.

(Image: PA)

(Image: PA)

However it wasn't one of the set officially released to celebrate their happy news, so fans were very excited to see the new image.

It shows Meghan in a blue dress and normally sits in a simple silver frame.

Kate and William's photo is also from their engagement shoot, and sits just behind in a wooden frame.

(Image: PA)

(Image: PA)

Some people have suggested that this may be to protect them after their recent documentary, in which they spoke openly about their struggles with royal life.

However it's likely to be that the Queen has just rearranged the photos and has decided to put it elsewhere, and photos from different angles at other events show she has an entire desk of photos directly in her eyeline.

She has a piece of paper and her glasses where the photo used to sit, so she might have just decided she needed a bit more free space.

(Image: Getty Images)

Royal fans love spotting all the photos in the Queen's home, but during her meeting with Boris there was something else that really caught their eye .

Sitting on the fireplace in front of the bench chair is a large Dyson air conditioning fan.

It looks like she's splashed out for the company's HP02 Hot + Cool Link model , which will set you back £480.

People were quick to notice the fancy addition and took to social media to praise the Queen for her choice.

But it was hardly surprising that the Queen has a fan in pride of place in the room after record breaking week of temperatures with highs of up to 39C.
description: The Queen has photos of her closest family in her living room at home, including Prince Harry, Meghan Markle, Kate Middleton, Prince William and Prince Charles
